finding: An intronic variant in FLT3 on 13q12.2, it was significantly associated with ALL (OR=1.79, p=3.2×10-5) and exhibited eQTL effects on FLT3 in whole blood.
title: Genetic Determinants of Blood Cell Traits Influence Susceptibility to Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs61955499 also exhibited female-specific effects, associated with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels and high BMI loss cluster membership.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: Identified as a dynamic caQTL for COL4A1, rs11838776 influenced enhancer accessibility that depended on SMC cell state and affected EGR1/2 transcription factor binding, revealing a complex relationship between cell state and genetic risk for CAD.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: Identified in association analyses, this variant is tied to prostate cancer risk through significant connections to PSA measures.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs342584 variant at the DIAPH3 locus conferred an increased risk of TP53-associated CH (OR = 2.63 [1.96-3.55], P = 3.58 x 10^-8).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: At rs772862932 related to ATP8A2, significant associations were noted for DBP under LTST (P_GxE=1.3×10^-6).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: This SNP was noted in the context of hypothyroidism and associated genes that have been studied in mice.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Identified as the second strongest signal in the GWAS for RAG, this SNP is located on chromosome 13 within the gene LOC105370101. It reached a genome-wide significance of P=5.7e-22, indicating its potential involvement in retinal aging mechanisms.
title: Genomic Determinants of Biological Age Estimated By Deep Learning Applied to Retinal Images

finding: The rs9536314 SNP, representing genetic variation in the Klotho (KL) locus, was associated with less frontal lobe grey matter in older individuals. This finding related to cognitive abilities, specifically indicating a potential link with cognitive decline and dementia risk, although no significant interactions with APOE e4 genotype were found.
title: Lack of evidence for interactions between APOE and Klotho genotypes on cognitive, dementia and brain imaging metrics in UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs1176317 was significantly associated with ITR as evidenced by a p-value of 4.18x10^-7. This SNP, located adjacent to the SPRY2 gene, had a minor allele (A) frequency of 23.97% in cases versus 56.82% in controls, with an odds ratio of 0.2396, indicating its potential influence on treatment response.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The variant rs80359803 was identified as a likely pathogenic <italic>BRCA2</italic> mutation, classified as significant in the ClinVar database. This synonymous variant, located on chromosome 13q12.3, was noted for its association with hereditary breast cancer in affected family members, emphasizing its clinical relevance and potential impact on mRNA splicing.
title: Familial Genetic Cancer Risk Assessment with respect to a Silent BRCA2 mutation

finding: The SNP rs12585631 was tied to the MICU2 gene and was associated with expression level changes, suggesting a functional relation to Kawasaki disease.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The SNP rs57668933, located within the intron of the ELF1 gene, was identified as a likely causal variant associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It was experimentally validated using CRISPR/Cas9 methods and showed allele-specific enhancer activity, correlating with higher ELF1 expression in immune cells from healthy controls.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The lead SNP rs7329174 was previously linked to ELF1 as an SLE risk gene, but evidence from rs57668933 indicated it is instead the likely causal variant impacting ELF1 expression.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs1792, related to the FARP1 gene, was also classified as a novel anxiety locus, and it was associated with excitatory synapse development and dendritic extensions.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The rs80359520 variant in BRCA2 was linked to a significant increase in mortality risk with a hazard ratio of 6.1 and a p-value of 1.8 x 10^-6.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The SNP rs7991229 was also a previously reported variant that showed significant association with retinal vessel tortuosity. Similar to rs1808382, it was linked to cardiovascular disease and involved in pathways related to vascular structure.
title: GWAS of Retinal Vessel Tortuosity Identifies 173 Novel Loci Revealing Genes and Pathways Associated with Vascular Pathomechanics and Cardiometabolic Diseases

finding: The CRYL1 variant was associated with mannonate levels, indicating its enzymatic activity in carbohydrate metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The variant SLC10A2 was associated with glycodeoxycholate 3-sulfate levels, indicating its importance in bile acid transport.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: An association was found at the rs12863716 locus with a p-value of 1.2x10^-9. While not definitively colocalizing with the primary trait in the UK Biobank, it suggested colocalization with FGF9 expression in the tibial artery, linking it to both aneurysms and the pathology of AAC, though formal colocalization analysis was not conducted due to data limitations.
title: Calcification of abdominal aorta is a high risk underappreciated cardiovascular disease factor in a general population

finding: The rs72665334 variant in intron 1 of the FGF14 gene was associated with idiopathic downbeat nystagmus (DBN) in 106 patients as identified in a recent genome-wide association study (GWAS). It was found to be in disequilibrium with the FGF14 (GAA) repeat expansion, particularly the (GAA)≥250 expansions, where a significantly greater proportion of patients carrying the CT or TT genotype also had this expansion (54% vs 14%, OR 7.18, p=0.0014). This finding underscored the potential genetic link between FGF14 variations and idiopathic DBN, presenting a basis for further research into genetic influences on the syndrome.
title: Intronic FGF14 GAA repeat expansions are a common cause of downbeat nystagmus syndromes: frequency, phenotypic profile, and 4-aminopyridine treatment response

finding: The SNP rs111399831 was noted for its association with irreversible EDSS milestones, with aHR of 0.77 (p=0.036) for irEDSS3 and 0.62 (p=2.82×10-4) for irEDSS6, suggesting its role in MS severity prediction.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The SNP rs4769612, located near the FLT1 gene, was identified as having a stronger association with late-onset preeclampsia (PE). This finding was significant as it contributed to the understanding that maternal genetic factors play a role in cases of late-onset PE.
title: Spatially Constrained Gene Regulation Identifies Key Genetic Contributions of Preeclampsia, Hypertension and Proteinuria

finding: The variant rs4769613 was linked to heightened susceptibility to both preeclampsia (PE) and hypertension (HTN), reinforcing the notion of shared genetic risk between these conditions.
title: Spatially Constrained Gene Regulation Identifies Key Genetic Contributions of Preeclampsia, Hypertension and Proteinuria

finding: The SNP rs12050029 was identified as being associated with risk for preeclampsia (PE) and also hypertension (HTN), illustrating the genetic relationship between these two pregnancy-related disorders.
title: Spatially Constrained Gene Regulation Identifies Key Genetic Contributions of Preeclampsia, Hypertension and Proteinuria

finding: The SNP rs12020287 was detailed in a study by Do et al. (2020), which analyzed the roles of chemokines and their receptors in cancer progression. It was emphasized that specific CCGs, including those referenced in the context of SNP rs12020287, served as potential cancer prognostic markers.
title: Blood cytokine analysis suggests that SARS-CoV-2 infection results in a sustained tumour promoting environment in cancer patients

finding: This SNP was marked as significant with a p-value of 3.7×10^-14, establishing its role in association with PSA levels.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs423117_T was found to be associated with higher HbA1c levels, which are used in diagnosing diabetes. This allele was linked to increased ATP11A expression in the liver and decreased expression in cultured fibroblasts. However, no association with ATP11A expression in blood was observed, highlighting tissue-specific effects.
title: Genetic overlap between idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and COVID−19

finding: The SNP rs9577395_C was associated with increased ATP11A expression in blood but correlated with a decreased risk of severe COVID-19. This indicated a complex interaction between the SNP and the phenotypes of IPF and COVID-19 severity, as it presented increased risk for IPF while demonstrating a protective effect against severe COVID-19.
title: Genetic overlap between idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and COVID−19

finding: Also strongly associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids, this SNP contributed to the understanding of genetic influences on metabolic processes and was considered in context with multiple other related traits.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs117887149 was identified as one of the lead variants at the 18 novel loci associated with hearing loss. It was noted to map close to the gene GJB2, which is a predominant cause of congenital hearing loss.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: Previously linked with lung cancer susceptibility, this SNP was speculated to be rare in its association but is now regarded as a common allele at the 13q13.1 locus associated with lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: This SNP at the 13q13.1 locus represented a common lung cancer allele, shedding new light on genetic factors influencing lung cancer risk.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: Variant rs9526201 in the LRCH1 gene was associated with colorectal cancer risk and diabetes interaction, with a significant p-value of 7.84×10−09 in joint tests. This variant influenced the association of diabetes with colorectal cancer risk, with an OR of 2.11 among GG genotype carriers (p-value: 8.9×10−07) and suggested eQTL roles in various tissues.
title: Probing the diabetes and colorectal cancer relationship using gene – environment interaction analyses

finding: A second genome-wide significant association at rs9547906 near the POSTN gene was found for spontaneous pneumothorax (p=7.8e-10, MAF=0.3357, OR=1.310), indicating its potential involvement in disease.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The intronic variant rs12585036:C>T in ATP11A was found to increase the risk for hospitalization (OR = 1.10, P = 3.2 × 10^-21) and associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: SNP rs7984597 was reported as a male-specific intergenic locus that also reached genome-wide significance and was associated with lower neuroticism scores.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: The SNP rs6313 was associated with serotonin concentration levels in autistic children as described in the study by Cieslinska et al. (2019). This finding was significant as it linked variations in the HTR2A gene to neurochemical profiles relevant to autism, supporting the role of serotonergic signaling in the neurobiology of autism.
title: Bridging the translational neuroscience gap: Development of the ‘shiftability’ paradigm and an exemplar protocol to capture psilocybin-elicited ‘shift’ in neurobiological mechanisms in autism

finding: Similar to rs6313, the SNP rs6314 was also linked to serotonin concentration levels in autistic children according to the study by Cieslinska et al. (2019). This association underscored the implication of the HTR2A gene in modulating serotonin levels, further corroborating the relevance of the serotonin system in autism spectrum disorders.
title: Bridging the translational neuroscience gap: Development of the ‘shiftability’ paradigm and an exemplar protocol to capture psilocybin-elicited ‘shift’ in neurobiological mechanisms in autism

finding: The BRCA2 splice acceptor variant c.517-2A>G (rs81002858) was found in breast and ovarian cancer families from Shetland, where it segregated with the disease. It showed a carrier frequency of 0.4% in the VIKING I cohort, approximately 130-fold higher than in the general UK Biobank population.
title: Two founder variants account for over 90% of pathogenic BRCA alleles in Orkney and Shetland

finding: The BRCA2 deletion variant c.6275_6276del p.Leu2092fs (rs11571658) was noted as a NE Scottish founder variant but was classified as a singleton in the Northern Isles cohort, indicating limited frequency and presumably more common ancestry beyond the islands.
title: Two founder variants account for over 90% of pathogenic BRCA alleles in Orkney and Shetland

finding: This variant at 13q12.2 was associated with kidney function traits, exhibiting higher allele frequency in the LLFS sample and implicating its relevance to eGFR.
title: Discovery of genomic and transcriptomic pleiotropy between kidney function and soluble receptor for advanced glycation end-products using correlated meta-analyses: The Long Life Family Study (LLFS)

finding: The SNP rs17086772 was linked to the SLC46A3 gene, identified as a weak association with rheumatoid arthritis through comparative analysis of GWAS results.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: Association of rs2985994 with COG3 was prioritized in regulatory analyses using SMR, indicating a role in ALS risk through eQTL and mQTL effects.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The lead variant rs2000660, located 12 kbp upstream of the COL4A1 gene, was significantly associated with cerebral atherosclerosis, presenting an odds ratio of 0.71 (p = 3.9 × 10-8). This finding positioned COL4A1 as a relevant factor in vascular phenotypes and was supported by prior GWAS as a risk locus for various vascular diseases.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiple neuropathology endophenotypes identifies novel risk loci and provides insights into known Alzheimer’s risk loci

finding: The rs138959102 SNP at the MZT1 locus was discovered as a new genome-wide significant risk locus in FTLD-TDP A, underlining its association with the disease.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: Near a previously associated CSF clusterin variant, rs4942482 replicated across three studies and was linked to genes involved in AD, reinforcing its association with AAO.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The SNP rs6311, located in the promoter region of the HTR2A gene, was reported to be associated with both the onset and severity of early onset obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). This finding was highlighted in a pilot study that specifically examined the connection between this polymorphism and the clinical characteristics of the disorder.
title: Contribution of rare variants to heritability of a disease is much greater than conventionally estimated: modification of allele distribution model

finding: The ATP7B c.1934T>G (p.Met645Arg, rs121907998) was also classified as pathogenic and had a prevalence exceeding 1%, linked to Wilson disease.
title: Unveiling the Landscape of Reportable Genetic Secondary Findings in the Spanish Population: A Comprehensive Analysis Using the Collaborative Spanish Variant Server Database

finding: The SNP rs9604045 was fine-mapped with a PIP of 0.99 and linked to LAMP1, providing evidence for its involvement in HDL cholesterol regulation.
title: Combining SNP-to-gene linking strategies to pinpoint disease genes and assess disease omnigenicity

finding: The SNP rs80338943, linked to the c.235delC mutation in the GJB2 gene, was identified in 1.40% (8 out of 571) of ESCC cases and was recognized as a common pathogenic mutation in East Asian populations.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: The SNP rs758732038 was identified as a pathogenic splice mutation, corresponding to the mutation c.-39-1_-39delGA in the BRCA2 gene, which was reported in ClinVar as likely pathogenic and has also been associated with breast cancer and medulloblastoma.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: Found in the MCF2L|ATP11A loci, this rs12585036-T allele was also shown to have protective effects for ILDs, highlighting its dual role in COVID-19 risk.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The SNP rs11571833, a rare BRCA2 variant (K3326X), was confidently associated with lung cancer (odds ratio=2.47, P=4.74×10^-20) but not influenced by smoking.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This SNP showed a significant relationship with PSA variations and was included in the relevant genetic findings.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Significant after Bonferroni correction among the CAD variants investigated in relation to T2D.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The A allele at rs79577162 in the DAOA region was found to be associated with a decrease in area under the BMI curve (AUC) during early childhood (1.5-3.5 years), with an effect size of -0.02 log BMI years (P=4×10^-8). It also reduced BMI at the adiposity peak (AP) by -0.13 kg/m^2 (P=2×10^-6) and at the adiposity rebound (AR) by -0.14 kg/m^2 (P=5×10^-6). Additionally, it decreased AUC across all time periods, but did not significantly affect slopes during childhood.
title: A framework for conducting time-varying genome-wide association studies: An application to body mass index across childhood in six multiethnic cohorts

finding: The lead variant rs7318880 at the FLT1 locus was found to have a genome-wide significant association with maternal preeclampsia. This locus is linked to sFlt1, an antiangiogenic protein whose levels increase in women destined to develop preeclampsia.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The variant rs16957301 located on chromosome 13 in the PCCA gene was identified as a significant risk genotype for ICI-AKI among self-reported Caucasians. The analysis indicated that individuals with the TC/CC genotypes developed acute kidney injury significantly earlier than those with the TT genotype, with a log-rank P-value of 0.04. Additionally, this variant demonstrated heightened odds ratios for developing ICI-AKI (2.24 for self-reported Caucasians and 2.11 for ancestry-estimated Caucasians), but it did not exhibit any significant associations with AKI risk in the general cohort.
title: PCCA variant rs16957301 is a novel AKI risk genotype-specific for patients who receive ICI treatment: Real-world evidence from All of Us cohort

finding: At the LRCH1 locus (rs9526214), a trivariate signal involving PAD, CAD, and HDL was identified (trivariate P=3.4×10^-11). This locus had previously shown significant associations with platelets and blood pressure, and increased LRCH1 expression was linked to higher atherosclerotic risk.
title: Multi-trait GWAS of atherosclerosis detects novel pleiotropic loci

finding: The SNP rs72665334 was associated with down beat nystagmus (DBN) based on GWAS findings. It was located approximately 10kb 3' of the GAA repeat expansion in the FGF14 gene locus. The study presented a common ancestral haplotype determined for three Australian cases with GAA>250, suggesting a potential relationship between DBN and FGF14 RE-mediated disease. The haplotype associated with this SNP was inferred to be on a founder haplotype in linkage disequilibrium with the FGF14 GAA repeat expansion.
title: A novel intronic GAA repeat expansion in FGF14 causes autosomal dominant adult-onset ataxia (SCA50, ATX-FGF14)

finding: The SNP rs11840593 was associated with the risk of heart failure, exhibiting a beta of -0.06 and a p-value of 9.00×10^-22. The connection to multiple genes involved in lens morphology indicated significant implications for understanding broader health outcomes related to the eye.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: The SNP rs61736969 in TBC1D4 was linked to lower expression of nine plasma proteins, including various interleukins and immune mediators, accounting for up to 18% of variance in diabetes cases in Greenland.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: At the LINC00441 locus, the lead SNP rs144131853 was associated with a decrease in vitamin D3 levels by 0.32 ng/mL.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The LINC00379-MIR17HG locus (lead SNP rs74241688) identified a novel association with estrone.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The rs3742264 SNP, specifically the A-allele in the donor, was associated with a reduced risk of graft loss following kidney transplantation, demonstrated by a hazard ratio of 0.71 (95% CI, 0.55–0.93; P=0.014). This association remained significant in fully adjusted models, suggesting a protective effect of this high-producing CPB2 variant.
title: Carboxypeptidase B2 gene polymorphisms in the donor associate with kidney allograft loss

finding: This intergenic SNP showed a significant negative association with non-AD inflammation specifically in females.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs9301365 showed an association with T2D, having a beta of 0.024 and a P value of 2.1 × 10^-16. This SNP was reported to be located within 500kb of IRS2.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The COG6 gene harbored the rs9603616 SNP that was associated with increased risk for rheumatoid arthritis when the minor allele was present.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The study identified a genome-wide significant association of rs7318880 in the FLT1 locus with preeclamptic mothers. This was the first time this locus was associated with maternal preeclampsia, and it is linked to sFlt1, a biomarker whose levels correlate with disease severity.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: This intergenic SNP was associated with lower WBC and neutrophil counts and provided insights into population-specific biological differences between AFR and EUR.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP (chr13:112882313:A:G) within ATP11A was reported as a lead variant, further linked to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, signifying its potential impact on COVID-19 severity.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The rs80338939 variant in GJB2, linked to hearing loss and deafness, was found at a frequency of 0.0156 in the Russian dataset, validating previous findings regarding its high occurrence in the region.
title: Expanding the Russian allele frequency reference via cross-laboratory data integration: insights from 6,096 exome samples

finding: This SNP was another putative novel ALL risk variant located in FLT3 on 13q12.2. It had an odds ratio (OR) of 1.79 (p=3.2x10^-5) and was recognized as an eQTL for FLT3, influencing ALL susceptibility via potential activation of the RAS/MAPK pathway.
title: Genetic Determinants of Blood Cell Traits Influence Susceptibility to Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

finding: Located in the super-variant chr7_23, this SNP contributed to susceptibility loci associated with COVID-19 mortality. The associated gene TOMM7 plays a role in mitochondrial function, which is linked to inflammatory responses in infected individuals.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: The analysis of the rs6311 polymorphism, specifically the HTR2A promoter polymorphism -1438G/A, previously demonstrated an association with the onset and severity of early onset obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). This association highlighted the significance of this SNP in the context of OCD phenotypes, providing original and positive findings regarding its impact on disease manifestation.
title: Contribution of rare variants to heritability of a disease is much greater than conventionally estimated: modification of allele distribution model

finding: The SNP rs9542236 located within HSPH1/B3GALTL was part of the genetic variants correlated with the progression to advanced AMD.
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: Identified at the 13q21.33 locus, this SNP showed a discovery p-value of 1.64×10^-6 with an OR of 1.69. This region contained genes actively transcribed during heart development and was nominally significant in the meta-analysis (p=1.45×10^-6, OR=1.63).
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The variant rs397507725 was classified as pathogenic through the application of ACMG guidelines. It was assigned the PVS1-Very Strong attribute due to its prediction to undergo Nonsense Mediated Decay and its presence in a biologically relevant transcript. Additionally, it was recognized as ClinVar Pathogenic and categorized as a rare variant absent in other populations.
title: Understanding the genetic epidemiology of hereditary breast cancer in India using whole genome data from 1029 healthy individuals

finding: The variant rs80358908 was classified as VUS by ACMG and distinguished as largely missing from other populations. However, it was predicted to be pathogenic by multiple computational tools, suggesting potential implications for breast cancer risk.
title: Understanding the genetic epidemiology of hereditary breast cancer in India using whole genome data from 1029 healthy individuals

finding: The SNP rs5960 was identified as the most significant variant associated with preeclampsia, situated in the clotting factor F10 gene. It demonstrated a high odds ratio (OR 3.05) and had a strong association with preeclampsia risk in the cohort of Andean families.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: SNP rs553316 was also identified as a top hit in the study, being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs5960 and acting as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the PROZ gene, indicative of its importance in preeclampsia.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The variant rs11571831 was exclusively found in populations of African ancestry. Its presence in NG men indicated a unique pattern distinct from other populations, although it was classified as a variant of unknown significance (VUS). Thus, it may contribute to the understanding of population-specific cancer risks.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing of Nigerian Prostate Tumors from the Prostate Cancer Transatlantic Consortium (CaPTC) Reveals DNA Repair Genes Associated with African Ancestry

finding: Identified as a significant locus for long sleep duration in the AFR population, this SNP reached genome-wide significance with p=2.6×10−8. It is intergenic to the LMO7 gene, implicated in several disease associations.
title: Genome-wide association study investigating short and long sleep duration: a cross-population meta-analysis

finding: The intergenic variant rs138347802, located between the non-coding RNAs LINC00378 and MIR3169, was significantly associated with reduced 28-day survival in sepsis patients. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing sepsis outcomes.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Study of Survival in Patients with Sepsis

finding: The SNP rs7993214 was located in significant genetic loci shared between RA and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The alternative splicing QTL (sQTL) rs12585036:T>C was associated with protection against all three adverse COVID-19 outcomes, with odds ratios indicating a significantly decreased risk of critical illness (OR 0.78), hospitalization (OR 0.84), and reported infection (OR 0.96), suggesting the importance of alternative splicing at this locus in COVID-19 severity.
title: Alternative splicing in the lung influences COVID-19 severity and respiratory diseases

finding: The SNP rs9796234 was found associated with GRK1 involved in the mechanism of Oguchi disease, indicating its influence on PRC layer thickness.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs7991229 had also been previously reported and was found to be associated with vascular tortuosity and metabolic conditions, although specifics were not detailed in the provided text.
title: GWAS of Retinal Vessel Tortuosity Identifies 173 Novel Loci Revealing Genes and Pathways Associated with Vascular Pathomechanics and Cardiometabolic Diseases

finding: The C allele of rs12585036 was associated with higher ATP11A expression in monocytes and lung tissue primarily from smokers, leading to increased risk of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) and decreased risk of critically ill COVID-19. Colocalization analyses in specific tissues revealed this association.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs17089782, a missense variant in the PIBF1 gene (p.R405Q) on chromosome 13, was significantly associated with thyroid cancer (p = 2.8×10−9). This gene is essential for immune regulation, particularly during pregnancy, and has relevance to autoimmune diseases and cancer.
title: Population-Specific Polygenic Risk Scores Developed for the Han Chinese

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with non-AD inflammation (PC4), with results showing strong association only in females (-0.97SD, SE=0.17, p=2.2*10^-8).
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs61965887 was associated with ABCC4 and showed significant connections to PSA levels, which may inform cancer diagnostics.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs117887149 was associated with hearing loss risk and mapped close to GJB2, which is known to be a predominant cause of congenital hearing loss. This finding indicated a genetic contribution to hearing loss from loci that include variants linked to GJB2.
title: Population-scale analysis of common and rare genetic variation associated with hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs72474224 was related to the GJB2 gene, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 8.6%. It was considered a 'mild' pathogenic variant, and the phenotype penetration was described as highly variable in clinical experiences in Taiwan. This finding contributed to the estimated carrier risk for offspring.
title: Complete genomic profiles of 1,496 Taiwanese reveal curated medical insights

finding: The rs9546244 SNP was identified as a novel significant association for grip strength in the non-dominant hand (GSND) with a p-value of 3.43e-08, linked to the long non-coding RNA LINC02465. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing grip strength in children.
title: A GWAS for grip strength in cohorts of children – advantages of analysing young participants for this trait

finding: rs7991229 was previously identified as associated with retinal vessel tortuosity, contributing to the largest GWAS of this trait.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of retinal vessel tortuosity identify 173 novel loci, capturing genes and pathways associated with disease and vascular tissue pathomechanics

finding: The SNP rs7994794 was associated with PIBF1 expression and IL1B regulation, indicating its involvement in pro-inflammatory responses upon Mtb exposure.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: The intronic variant rs12585036:C>T in ATP11A had an OR of 1.10 (95% CI = 1.08–1.12, P = 3.2 × 10−21) for hospitalization.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs80338939 variant in GJB2 was linked to hearing loss and deafness, and was identified at a high frequency (AF = 0.0170) in the Russian dataset, consistent with previous findings.
title: Expanding the Russian allele frequency reference via cross-laboratory data integration: insights from 7,452 exome samples

finding: For rs9506925, the SNP showed linkage to the FGF9 promoter via PC-HiC, with a PIP of 0.76. FGF9 is known to play a significant role in cardiac development and signaling, indicating its potential involvement in heart-related phenotypes.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of cardiac traits

finding: The SNP rs79276590 was identified as significant in males at the TEX29 locus with a p-value of 3.0 × 10<sup>−8</sup> and was linked to the gene TUBGCP3.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: The SNP rs9568417 at the DLEU1 locus (13q14.2) was significant at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 2.24x10^-4 related to endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: This SNP was highlighted as significant in the autism multivariate GWAS context, adding to the understanding of its relationship with autism.
title: Exploring autism and autism co-occurring condition associations to elucidate multivariate genetic mechanisms and insights

finding: This SNP was validated as a functional variant regulating the expression of the SLE risk gene ELF1 in multiple immune cell types. Higher chromatin accessibility and enhancer activity were associated with the protective T allele.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs9301365 was linked to type 2 diabetes (T2D) with a beta of 0.024 and a P-value of 2.1 × 10^-16, demonstrating a strong correlation with diabetes susceptibility.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs7991229, mapping to the COL4A2 gene, was significantly associated with retinal vessel tortuosity with a p-value lower than 5·10−8, indicating its crucial role in the genetic architecture of this trait.
title: GWAS of Retinal Vessel Tortuosity Identifies 173 Novel Loci Revealing Genes and Pathways Associated with Vascular Pathomechanics and Diseases

finding: The common variant rs9513522 at the known DOCK9 gene locus was associated with high myopia with a significant P-value of 1.10 × 10^-8. This locus was previously identified as a clinical hallmark of HM due to its association with irregular astigmatism and corneal ectasia.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: The 3' UTR variant rs7334543 in BRCA2 was associated with a decreased risk of overall HNSCC (OR: 0.91, 95% CI: 0.88, 0.94; p=2.39×10^-8) and was independent from another BRCA2 stop gain variant previously identified.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The stop-gain variant rs11571833 in BRCA2 was strongly linked to increased risk in laryngeal cancer (LA) and head and neck cancers (HPC), with ORs of 2.09 (95% CI: 1.65, 2.66) and 2.73 (95% CI: 1.61, 3.90) respectively, showing significant interaction with smoking and drinking.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs9536314, part of the KL-VS haplotype, demonstrated a nominally significant association with lower risk of developing Alzheimer disease (AD) in cognitively healthy APOE4 carriers. Specifically, individuals heterozygous for this variant (KL-VS<sup>HET+</sup>) had an odds ratio (OR) of 0.67 for CSF Aβ positivity, suggesting a protective effect against amyloid burden during normal aging.
title: Leveraging large multi-center cohorts of Alzheimer Disease endophenotypes to understand the role of Klotho heterozygosity on disease risk

finding: The SNP rs9527025, also part of the KL-VS haplotype, was associated with lower odds of tau pathology in elderly individuals who were cognitively normal and APOE4 carriers. It showed an odds ratio (OR) of 0.50 for the pTau biomarker, indicating that KL-VS<sup>HET+</sup> status may mitigate cognitive decline related to tau protein accumulation.
title: Leveraging large multi-center cohorts of Alzheimer Disease endophenotypes to understand the role of Klotho heterozygosity on disease risk

finding: Variant rs183091953 in the CARS2 locus was associated with a leukotriene and was identified as a rare variant in the HCHS/SOL study, suggesting its role in the genetic architecture of inflammation.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The SNP rs4884091 was found to be nominally significant for SSRI non-response and had been previously associated with SSRI non-response in the GWAS from the 23andMe Team. Its association highlighted its potential role in non-response to antidepressant treatment, particularly concerning genes such as POU4F1.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: The SNP rs71449058 was found to be located on chromosome 13 and mapped nearest to the gene RASA3. It demonstrated a protective effect against Epstein Barr Virus (EBV) infection, with a significant association reported at p=2.34×10^-10.
title: Unpicking the Gordian knot: Mendelian randomization to elucidate the risk factors for infectious diseases, using EBV as a model pathogen

finding: The variant rs1278769 (chr13:112882313:A:G) was reported as significant, indicating its involvement in critical illness related to COVID-19.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: This SNP was previously associated with retinal vessel tortuosity, suggesting its relevance in the genetic architecture of this trait.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of retinal vessel tortuosity identify 173 novel loci, capturing genes and pathways associated with disease and vascular tissue pathomechanics

finding: The SNP rs71449058 was identified in a GWAS as being located on chromosome 13, mapping nearest to the gene RASA3. It demonstrated a protective effect against Epstein Barr Virus (EBV) infection, with a p-value of 2.34×10−10.
title: Unpicking the Gordian knot: Mendelian randomization to elucidate the risk factors for infectious diseases, using EBV as a model pathogen

finding: The variant rs45604939, p.Thr1017Ala in FNDC3A, was associated with higher total cholesterol in a FinnDiane dataset (MAF=0.063, p=0.04). This association was replicated in external studies and demonstrated relevance to multiple circulatory phenotypes.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: This intronic variant in the HS6ST2 gene was associated with fasting glucose (FG) specifically in the Hispanic/Latinx population, correlating with obesity and impaired glucose metabolism.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs181401679 was identified as the top associated variant linked to large artery ischemic stroke in a whole genome association analysis conducted by the Trans-Omics Precision Medicine (TOPMed) program.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs1359790 was linked to the SPRY2 locus and was part of the seven SNPs shared between type 2 diabetes and depression.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs866376 in 13q14.13 exhibited genetic influences between the fifth principal component of the Vgg16 model on fundus images (Vgg16_PC5) and ischemic stroke, confirming a high posterior probability of shared causality (PPH4 = 0.994).
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs9526212 was linked to ischemic stroke in combination with Vgg16_PC5, confirming the genetic overlap observed.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11571833 at the 13q13.1 locus had been previously associated with lung cancer susceptibility, with a lower frequency variant noted.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The common allele SNP rs11571734 at 13q13.1 was identified as a lung cancer susceptibility variant.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: SNP rs11841641 was identified as one of the four novel anxiety loci, but no further functional context was provided in the results.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The missense SNP rs3764147 in the gene LACC1 was replicated in African populations with a p-value of 0.004 and an odds ratio of 1.36 (95% CI 1.10 - 1.67), indicating its role in modifying susceptibility to leprosy.
title: ACTR1A has pleiotropic effects on risk of leprosy, inflammatory bowel disease and atopy

finding: The study identified a pathogenic variant in the BRCA2 gene (snp rs28897756), which is clinically associated with an increased risk of breast cancer. This finding indicated that one participant had a genetic predisposition that could potentially lead to preventive health measures.
title: Cohort profile: The I AM Frontier prospective cohort study in Flanders

finding: The variant in TBC1D4 (rs61736969), known for its role in insulin resistance, was associated with lower levels of nine plasma proteins including various interleukins and chemokines significant in inflammation.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: The NUDT15 variant rs116855232-T was found to have a 6.5-fold enrichment in Finland compared to non-Finnish Europeans, with a minor allele frequency of 0.02 in both GnomAD Finns and SUPER-Finland, while it was 0.004 in general European populations.
title: Implementation of CYP2D6 copy-number imputation panel and frequency of key pharmacogenetic variants in Finnish individuals with a psychotic disorder

finding: Also part of the significant locus 13q14.11, this SNP demonstrated a strong association with TBS, indicating its contribution to the genetic determinants of bone microarchitecture.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: The SNP rs4411372, an intronic variant near the STK24 gene on chromosome 13, was identified as a novel association with impulsivity, showing broad links to cognitive and psychiatric outcomes with a P-omnibus value of 1.16e-8.
title: The pleiotropic architecture of human impulsivity across biological scales

finding: Variant rs59310144 was found to decrease NKX2-5 DNA binding and was associated with the gene RNASEH2B, which was upregulated when the alternate allele was present in cardiac tissue.
title: Prioritizing Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Variants Altering NKX2-5 Binding through an Integrative Computational Approach

finding: The missense mutation in F10 was identified as protective against pulmonary embolism, corroborated by its associations with reduced plasma coagulation factor levels.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: The SNP rs506576 (EA = T, P = 1.0×10⁻⁸, β = 0.49) was associated with measles virus antibodies, marking a novel finding in the study.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: The SNP rs1409440 was associated with lipoedema through a meta-analysis, showing an odds ratio of approximately 2.01 and a P-value of about 4 x 10⁻⁶. This SNP was located within a block of linkage disequilibrium on chromosome 13 near the LHFPL6 gene and was found to play a role in regulating the expression of this gene, particularly in skin tissue.
title: Investigation of clinical characteristics and genome associations in the ‘UK Lipoedema’ cohort

finding: The SNP rs7994616 was positively associated with lipoedema in the same meta-analysis as rs1409440, displaying consistent significant effects. It was positioned within the same linkage disequilibrium block on chromosome 13 near the LHFPL6 gene and was linked to the expression regulation of LHFPL6 in relevant tissues.
title: Investigation of clinical characteristics and genome associations in the ‘UK Lipoedema’ cohort

finding: The SNP rs11616618 was identified as a significant marker for lipoedema in the meta-analysis that yielded an odds ratio of approximately 2.01 and a P-value close to 4 x 10⁻⁶. Like the other two SNPs, it was part of a linkage disequilibrium region on chromosome 13 near LHFPL6, contributing to its expression regulation.
title: Investigation of clinical characteristics and genome associations in the ‘UK Lipoedema’ cohort

finding: SNP rs17486822 was discovered within a glutamatergic-specific enhancer in the intronic region of the NALCN gene. This finding provided evidence of cell-specific regulation, linking extracellular Na+ influence on neuron excitability to schizophrenia risk.
title: Biological Insights from Schizophrenia-associated Loci in Ancestral Populations

finding: The SNP rs57022825, together with rs17486822, was located in a glutamatergic enhancer within NALCN and supported strong links to schizophrenia, validating its impact on neuronal function in a cell-specific context.
title: Biological Insights from Schizophrenia-associated Loci in Ancestral Populations

finding: It was confirmed as genome-wide significant for pancreatic cancer risk, further supporting prior findings.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: It was genome-wide significantly associated with pancreatic cancer in this GWAS meta-analysis, supporting earlier studies.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs7993214 was linked to the COG6 gene in SFs, showing stronger eQTL effects in proinflammatory conditions. This finding aligned with previous associations of this locus with autoimmune diseases, contributing further to the understanding of RA heritability.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs9603616 was identified in tight linkage disequilibrium with rs7993214 and was involved in eQTL effects for COG6, reinforcing its significance in the context of RA and related autoimmune diseases.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs12020259 was associated with the oncogenic roles of Rab GTPases in cancer pathways. Specifically, it was found in studies that highlighted the involvement of endosomal trafficking through the Arf/Rab interaction, including its implications in glioblastoma growth. The finding relates to the comprehensive understanding of glioblastoma by revealing how alterations in GTPase activities could impact tumorigenesis, particularly through mechanisms that involve cell migration and survival pathways.
title: An Arf/Rab cascade controls the growth and invasiveness of glioblastoma

finding: SNP rs4769283 was located in an intergenic region near MIPEP and identified as a significant eQTL for C1QTNF9B in the pancreas, a critical organ in type 1 diabetes pathology. This association was noted as novel and not previously established.
title: DeepCOMBI: Explainable artificial intelligence for the analysis and discovery in genome-wide association studies

finding: This SNP was found to alter the MEF2A motif leading to increased H3K27ac peak height and subsequent increase in KLF12 gene expression.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The rs1805097 variant in the IRS2 gene was noted for its variance in frequency among Ukrainians versus other European populations, associated with longevity and type II diabetes susceptibility.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: This SNP associated with FLT3, a gene critical in hematopoiesis and often mutated in AML, indicating a poor prognosis.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs3093233 was associated with FA7 protein levels and known as an eQTL for F7 and F10 in various tissues.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: Detection of a distant mutually exclusive pair of exons was made in the MBNL2 gene implicated in myotonic dystrophy, overlapping a targeted haplotype block associated with alcoholism. The exon pair was analyzed, showcasing significant coordination in splicing, with a highly significant Fisher's exact test p-value.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The SNP rs2876767 was associated with MS severity and progression through its proximity to the gene Spry2/SPRY2, which was identified as the closest gene related to a suggestive hit on chromosome 13. This association was highlighted in the most recent International MS genetics Consortium GWAS analysis, indicating its relevance in the genetic architecture underlying MS disease progression.
title: Probing the basis of disease heterogeneity in multiple sclerosis using genetically diverse mice

finding: The rs397507891 SNP was associated with a G>A mutation at the canonical splice donor site of exon 13 in the BRCA2 gene, classified as Pathogenic in ClinVar. This mutation was implicated in splice disruption and loss-of-function based on depletion of alleles observed in validation experiments.
title: Massively parallel assessment of human variants with base editor screens

finding: The rs81002816 SNP represented a G>A mutation 5 nucleotides into the intron adjacent to the splice donor site in the BRCA2 gene. ClinVar listed this variant as having conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity, and the splicing intolerance analysis suggested this mutation could disrupt splicing, indicating a potential loss-of-function effect.
title: Massively parallel assessment of human variants with base editor screens

finding: The SNP rs9545047 was identified as the index SNP from a genome-wide association study (GWAS) for schizophrenia. It exhibited perfect linkage disequilibrium with a single nucleotide polymorphism within an open chromatin region mapped in the fetal frontal cortex. This SNP was also recognized as a significant expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the genes LINC01068 and LINC01038 specifically in the human fetal brain. This finding underscored its potential importance in regulating gene expression during neurodevelopment, linking it to schizophrenia risk.
title: Sites of active gene regulation in the prenatal frontal cortex and their role in neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The lead SNP rs76428106 for the FLT3 gene was identified as the largest-effect association outside the HLA region, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.53. This variant was associated with increased monocyte count, highlighting its biological significance with a BFDR of 1.26e-4, solidifying its role in immune response.
title: Enhanced genetic analysis of type 1 diabetes by selecting variants on both effect size and significance, and by integration with autoimmune thyroid disease

finding: The SNP rs6314, also known as His452Ty or C1354>T, was linked to depression and cocaine use disorder through its association with the 5-HT2AR gene. This indicated the SNP's involvement in neuropsychiatric conditions, particularly those related to substance abuse and mood disorders.
title: Protein Co-Evolution Strategies Detect Predicted Functional Interaction Between the Serotonin 5-HT2A and 5-HT2C Receptors

finding: Associated with LDL levels, highlighting its role in the etiology of both coronary artery disease and lipid-related traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: In breast cancer, the functional SNP rs3827693 was found to affect the interaction between MALAT1 target, miR-143-3p, and RALGAPA2. This was a significant finding as it highlighted the role of this SNP in cancer pathogenesis, indicating its potential as a biomarker for breast cancer.
title: Nano Pom-poms Prepared Highly Specific Extracellular Vesicles Expand the Detectable Cancer Biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs1028727 was located approximately 10 kb upstream of the SERPINE3 transcription start site and was associated with a decreased area of the optic nerve head, suggesting a role in eye-related phenotypes linked to this gene.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: The SNP rs7327381 was found approximately 97 kb downstream of the SERPINE3 transcription start site and was associated with an increase in corneal curvature, reinforcing the proposed ocular function of SERPINE3.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: The SNP rs1753776 was associated with the Protein Kinase C delta (PKCdelta), demonstrating its involvement in photoperiod and circadian period phenotype alterations as revealed by the knockout mutants analyzed in the study.
title: Characterizing Genetic Mechanisms Involved in Measuring Day-length in Drosophila melanogaster

finding: The variant rs113317084 was associated with both an i-eQTL-targeted region (DER32583) and the ge-eQTL-targeted gene DNAJC15, demonstrating it shared signals between these two regulatory categories.
title: Regulatory sites for known and novel splicing in human basal ganglia are enriched for disease-relevant information

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs17446614 was also recognized for its association with genetic susceptibility to diabetic nephropathy. This SNP is located in the FOXO1 gene, which plays a crucial role in glucose metabolism and insulin signaling, thereby contributing to the understanding of how genetic variations can influence metabolic disorder outcomes.
title: A natural genetic variation screen identifies insulin signaling, neuronal communication, and innate immunity as modifiers of hyperglycemia in the absence of Sirt1

finding: The SNP rs9574096 was associated with mathematical ability and was linked with the gene neurobeachin (NBEA). NBEA exhibited elevated expression in the human embryonic neocortex compared to the macaque. A loss of RFX3 binding at the human allele T contributed to increased NBEA expression, which is linked to autism-like behavior in mice.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: SNP rs9574095, which has a strong correlation with rs9574096, was also related to mathematical ability and the gene NBEA, showing higher expression in human neocortex. The findings suggested changes in enhancer activity affecting NBEA, further linked to neural developmental processes related to autism.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: The rs7140110 variant at the GAS6 locus was newly found to be associated with total cholesterol (TC) in the study, while prior evidence linked it to LDL-C and triglycerides (TG).
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: Associated with LAMP1 and its effect on C-reactive protein levels, this variant was among those overlapping GWAS variants indicating inflammation relevance.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The rs7982677 variant was located in intron 7-8 of the GPC5 gene and was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with 44 other genomic variants. It was identified within a locus strongly correlated with the risk of Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF), a significant type of congenital heart disease. The analysis suggested that the regulatory effects of the rs7982677 haploblock likely influenced the expression of GPC6 rather than GPC5, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors leading to TOF.
title: Glypican-6 deficiency causes dose-dependent conotruncal congenital heart malformations through abnormal remodelling of the endocardial cushions

finding: Found at the COL4A2 locus, this variant demonstrated significant peaks in various cell types, further supporting its role in CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs1272422512 was found to result in a mutation (R9Q) that increased the nucleation of the ADan peptide. This finding was significant, as it represented the only SNP among the 18 analyzed that had a positive impact on the nucleation process, contributing to the understanding of amyloid formation related to familial Danish and British Dementia.
title: Amyloids “at the border”: deep mutagenesis and random sequence extension reveal an incomplete amyloid-forming motif in Bri2 that turns amyloidogenic upon C-terminal extension

finding: The SNP rs5010027 was identified as a pertinent therapeutic target in solid tumors through its involvement with integrin α5β1, the fibronectin receptor. Elevated expression of this receptor was correlated with tumor progression in the context of HCC, implicating the SNP in mechanisms that may contribute to aggressive tumor behavior and metastasis.
title: Modelling liver cancer microenvironment: novel 3D culture system as a potential anti-cancer drug screening tool

finding: The SNP rs80285134 was found to be a significant intergenic variant located between the genes GPC5 and GPC6, associated with height-specific differences in BMI. In individuals with short stature, the A allele of this SNP increased BMI (beta= 0.30, P = 5.9 × 10⁻⁴), while in tall individuals, it decreased BMI (beta= -0.37, P= 1.7 × 10⁻⁶). Additionally, PHEWAS highlighted that this SNP was significantly associated with bone mineral density, indicating a potential role in osteoporosis.
title: Genome-wide analyses point to differences in genetic architecture of BMI between tall and short people

finding: Variants in the region of rs188167837 were previously identified to be associated with nasopharyngeal carcinoma.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: This frameshift variant impacting coagulation factor F7 was associated with reduced protein abundance. Its mechanism may involve affecting the specificity of antibody quantification in assays, signifying its potential role in thrombin production pathways.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: The SNP rs728075 was also tied to the regulation of the gene IGF1R, demonstrating significant maternal expression with an adjusted p-value of 3.57×10^-64. This underscores its function as a candidate cis-eQTL.
title: A statistical method for joint estimation of cis-eQTLs and parent-of-orign effects using an orthogonal framework with RNA-seq data

finding: The SNP rs7329291 was linked with significant regulation of the IGF1R gene, showing a maternal expression pattern and an adjusted p-value of 3.57×10^-64, supporting its role as a candidate cis-eQTL.
title: A statistical method for joint estimation of cis-eQTLs and parent-of-orign effects using an orthogonal framework with RNA-seq data

finding: This SNP corresponds to rs332577759, confirmed to be critical in the CCK gene for pigs, showing a significant functional potential as evidenced by its classification as Category 2d within regulatory regions.
title: Annotation and assessment of functional variants in regulatory regions using epigenomic data in farm animals

finding: Associated with Lean Body Mass (LBM) as a cis-eQTL for KLF5, which was significantly related to LBM in multi-omics studies. This reinforces the connection between genetic variation at this locus and physical traits.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: The rs9520848-C allele in a Neanderthal haplotype was associated with higher basal expression of TNFSF13B in MAIT cells.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The SNP rs73183592 was linked via long-range interactions to FOXO1, established as important in Treg regulation and psoriasis development. This connection was specific to keratinocytes, underscoring the distinct cellular interactions pertinent to skin-associated diseases.
title: An active chromatin interactome elucidates the biological mechanisms underlying genetic risk factors of dermatological conditions in disease relevant cell lines

finding: The rs9514828C>T polymorphism in the TNFSF13B gene was found to be associated with high BAFF expression, which was linked to active disease in systemic lupus erythematosus. This finding supports the role of elevated BAFF in autoimmune disease pathology and suggests a broader context in which BAFF can influence B cell differentiation and activation.
title: Thyroid hormone induces B cells abnormal differentiation via overexpression of B cell-activating factor

finding: This SNP was associated with left-handedness versus non-left-handedness with a p-value of 4.7E-08, positioned within an intron of the non-coding RNA gene LINC00381.
title: The molecular genetics of hand preference revisited

finding: The trimodal QTL rs9604045 was associated with the gene LAMP1 and was involved in inflammation-related traits, thereby linking it to C-reactive protein levels as implicated in GWAS.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs9515203 was found to be overlapping with EC4-specific peaks, linking it to the COL4A1 and COL4A2 genes. This association suggested that rs9515203 might play a role in the endothelial cell heterogeneity related to coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: Single cell ‘omic profiles of human aortic endothelial cells in vitro and human atherosclerotic lesions ex vivo reveals heterogeneity of endothelial subtype and response to activating perturbations

finding: This SNP was attributed to KBTBD6, indicating strong colocalization with eQTLs in blood samples and demonstrating its role in telomere length regulation through its participation in an E3 ubiquitin ligase complex.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: Colocalized in regions of active chromatin, this SNP was involved in regulating POP5 expression and identified as a novel gene implicated in telomere length regulation.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: The SNP rs9520823 was associated with a later age of onset for Alzheimer's disease. It was ranked second in both the CALF4 and LASSO.2 regression solutions and showed a positive regression weight, indicating a potential protective effect against earlier onset of AD. This SNP lies in an intron of the ABHD13 gene, which is involved in lipid synthesis and metabolism, an area of significant relevance in AD research.
title: Frisky CALF sometimes outruns LASSO

finding: The variant rs9603616 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and targeted in a study of HEK2937T cells. The research assessed its effect on the expression of the COG6 gene, demonstrating a significant fold change in gene expression compared to a negative control, which indicated its role as a functional enhancer.
title: Analysis of chromatin organization and gene expression in T cells identifies functional genes for rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The variant rs7993214 was involved in analyzing interactions at the COG6/FOXO1 locus. CRISPR/Cas9 was employed to target an active enhancer marked by H3K27ac near this GWAS variant, leading to a demonstrable effect on FOXO1 gene expression. This highlighted complex interactions relevant to gene regulation in the context of rheumatoid arthritis.
title: Analysis of chromatin organization and gene expression in T cells identifies functional genes for rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The variant rs76428106, located in the FLT3 gene, demonstrated a significant association with increased monocyte count, providing the largest known risk effect for T1D outside the HLA region, with an OR of 1.53 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1.29%.
title: Enhanced genetic analysis of type 1 diabetes by selecting variants on both effect size and significance, and by integration with autoimmune thyroid disease

finding: The SNP rs72474224 C>T in GJB2 was linked to non-syndromic hearing loss and deafness, the most prevalent genetic disorder in the Vietnamese population. The allele frequency for this SNP was 60% higher in the Vietnamese population compared to East Asia, and an order of magnitude higher than in the world population, highlighting its significant prevalence in Vietnam.
title: Genetic profiling of Vietnamese population from large-scale genomic analysis of non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant eQTL effects on the COG6 gene in stimulated SFs and has been associated with autoimmune diseases, indicating its relevance in RA pathogenesis.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: rs9603616 was indicated to be in tight linkage disequilibrium with rs7993214, highlighting its association with the COG6 gene and thereby suggesting its role in RA and possibly other autoimmune diseases.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The EDNRB polymorphism rs10507875 was identified as having a joint effect with the NOS3 polymorphism, increasing the risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus and diabetic retinopathy in Slovenian patients.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The COL4A1 gene polymorphisms rs605143 was associated with coronary artery disease, which is commonly comorbid with type 2 diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: Similar associations were reported for rs565470, linking certain COL4A1 polymorphisms to increased coronary artery disease risk in diabetic patients.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs2504235 was identified as a genome-wide significant hit associated with Tourette's Syndrome (TS) and was located within the FLT3 gene. The analysis suggested that increased expression of FLT3 in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) correlated with TS. Additionally, global dysregulation of FLT3 was noted across multiple brain regions, and causal fine-mapping prioritized FLT3 with a high posterior inclusion probability, suggesting a significant role in the disorder.
title: Increased expression of genetically-regulated FLT3 implicated in Tourette’s Syndrome

finding: The rs41281112 SNP resulted in a loss-of-function variant of CLYBL, which was strongly associated with decreased levels of circulating vitamin B12. This SNP converted arginine 259 into a premature stop codon in the CLYBL protein, leading to protein loss and subsequent vitamin B12 deficiency, particularly impacting methionine synthesis and methylmalonyl-CoA mutase function.
title: CLYBL averts methylmalonyl-CoA mutase inhibition and loss of vitamin B12 by eliminating malyl-CoA

finding: The rs3783185 SNP introduced an Ile241Val mutation in the CLYBL protein, which was identified within an overexpression study. This particular variant was noted in the context of the CLYBL natural variant and contributed to creating an understanding of CLYBL functionality, linking it to broader metabolic pathways and vitamin B12 processing.
title: CLYBL averts methylmalonyl-CoA mutase inhibition and loss of vitamin B12 by eliminating malyl-CoA

finding: The rs1885988 C allele was associated with enhanced weight loss and weight retention after lifestyle interventions in major cohorts such as the Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP) and Look AHEAD cohorts. In these studies, homozygous minor allele carriers exhibited a greater propensity for weight loss over a 12-month period and better weight retention over 18-36 months compared to major allele carriers, indicating its significant role in modulating body weight responses.
title: Identification of a weight loss-associated causal eQTL in MTIF3 and the effects of MTIF3 deficiency on human adipocyte function

finding: The Gas6 gene rs8191974 was associated with type 2 diabetes in the northern Chinese Han population, highlighting its possible involvement in the pathogenesis of T2DM within this demographic.
title: Analysis of key genes and pathways associated with the pathogenesis of Type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: This SNP was associated with clonal loss of RB1 and showed directionally correct relationships with biochemical relapse.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The research indicated that the G72 rs1421292 polymorphism was associated with verbal function in individuals with schizophrenia. This finding contextualized the genetic factor's role in the abnormal gray matter volume of the right middle temporal gyrus, a brain region implicated in auditory hallucinations. As such, the study supported the relevance of rs1421292 in understanding the neurobiological underpinnings of schizophrenia.
title: Alteration of Power Law Scaling of Spontaneous Brain Activity in Schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs7328203 had been shown to interact with both the AKAP11 and TNFSF11 promoters, indicating that it potentially regulated the expression of both genes through direct enhancer-promoter loops.
title: cLoops2: a full-stack comprehensive analytical tool for chromatin interactions

finding: The SNP rs9533100 was identified to interact with both the AKAP11 and TNFSF11 promoters, suggesting a role in the regulation of the expression of these genes via direct enhancer-promoter loops.
title: cLoops2: a full-stack comprehensive analytical tool for chromatin interactions

finding: The SNP rs35860234 exhibited interaction with both the AKAP11 and TNFSF11 promoters, implying its potential role in regulating the expression of both genes through direct enhancer-promoter loops.
title: cLoops2: a full-stack comprehensive analytical tool for chromatin interactions

finding: The SNP rs9594746 was found to interact with both the AKAP11 and TNFSF11 promoters, which signified that this SNP might regulate the expression of both these genes via direct enhancer-promoter loops.
title: cLoops2: a full-stack comprehensive analytical tool for chromatin interactions

finding: The rs111748421 variant in SMAD9 was identified as a rare missense mutation (c.65T>C, p.Leu22Pro) that segregated with high bone mass (HBM) in affected individuals. The mutation was present in three individuals with HBM and predicted to be pathogenic by several algorithms, highlighting its potential role in HBM and bone biology.
title: A rare SMAD9 mutation identifies the BMP signalling pathway as a potential osteoanabolic target

finding: The rs12427846 SNP was strongly associated with estimated bone mineral density (eBMD) in a large population-based GWAS, with a leading p-value of 5.5×10^-16. This SNP demonstrated a significant correlation with both DXA-measured total body BMD and fracture risk, reinforcing its importance in bone health and linking SMAD9 to common variants associated with BMD.
title: A rare SMAD9 mutation identifies the BMP signalling pathway as a potential osteoanabolic target

finding: This SNP was found in individuals S15 and JAG93 from the Jagodnjak site, associated with Lig4 syndrome, which is characterized by skeletal abnormalities. Despite the exclusion of the Jagodnjak group from further analyses due to potential false positives, individual S15 exhibited skeletal features consistent with this disease, suggesting the possibility of the actual presence of this allele in the Encrusted pottery population.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: The SNP rs9540720 was linked to Major Depression Disorder (MDD) and cognitive function impairment through a meta-analysis of three genome-wide association studies (GWAS). This SNP was predicted to lower PCDH9 expression, as evidenced by reduced PCDH9 transcript levels found in MDD patients compared to healthy controls, indicating the identification of PCDH9 as a susceptibility locus for MDD.
title: Disruption of autism-associated Pcdh9 gene leads to transcriptional alterations, synapses overgrowth and aberrant excitatory transmission in the CA1

finding: Associated with risk of all subtypes, the OR values for grade 3 and grade 2 were 1.48 (p=2.3×10^-19) and 1.27 (p=5.0×10^-12), respectively, showing a strong relationship with tumor grade.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Rs73449607 was associated with a 0.49-fold (95% CI = 0.40-0.65) decrease in geometric mean percent pancreatic fat (Beta = -0.67, P = 4.50×10^-8), indicating a significant negative correlation with pancreatic fat content. Additionally, this SNP was associated with a nominally significant decreased risk of type 2 diabetes (OR = 0.95, 95% CI = 0.89-1.00, P = 0.047) in a broader population.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pancreatic Fat: The Multiethnic Cohort Adiposity Phenotype Study

finding: The rs9555695 SNP was located within the intronic region of COL4A2 associated with various glycaemic traits and was shown to overlap enhancer chromatin states in adipose tissue, suggesting its potential role in glycaemic regulation.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The SNP rs9573140 was associated with estrogen receptor-negative breast cancer, where it was correlated with other common SNPs in the vicinity of KLF12 and KLF5.
