Its odds ratio (OR) was reported as 0.94, with a significant p-value suggesting its involvement in the risk of developing this subtype of breast cancer.
title: Rare copy number variants (CNVs) and breast cancer risk

finding: SNP rs150928081, located in FREM2, was identified as significantly enriched in GBA1-N409S carriers, contributing additional evidence for genetic influences on PD.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The lead SNP near ZIC2, rs1034266, was replicated as significant in sagittal NCS cases, indicating its role in cranial vault shape.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: This variant, associated with autoimmune thyroiditis (AITD), was in high LD (r²=0.93) with the sentinel cis pQTL for TNFSF11, indicating a link between higher levels of TNFSF11 and reduced AITD risk (7% decrease).
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: This SNP is associated with LDL and lies in the RASA3 gene (13q34), contributing significantly to cardiovascular disease traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: This indel was also predicted as somatic and was identified as the BRCA2 P1062_Q1063fs mutation, which is recognized as a cancer predisposition mutation on ClinVar.
title: RNAIndel: a machine-learning framework for discovery of somatic coding indels using tumor RNA-Seq data

finding: The SNP rs4769613 was identified as part of the preeclampsia-gained enhancers for the FLT1 gene. This enhancer showed a gain of chromatin accessibility and a loss of DNA methylation, indicating its involvement in the epigenetic changes associated with preeclampsia. Its connection to the fetal genome susceptibility locus linked rs4769613 to the propensity for developing preeclampsia.
title: Developmentally Delayed Epigenetic Reprogramming Underlying the Pathogenesis of Preeclampsia

finding: Similar to rs4769613, the SNP rs12050029 was also identified within the context of FLT1 gene enhancers that exhibited changes in chromatin accessibility and DNA methylation, pointing towards its role in preeclampsia-related genetic susceptibility. The association with preeclampsia was further reinforced by its presence in the known susceptibility locus.
title: Developmentally Delayed Epigenetic Reprogramming Underlying the Pathogenesis of Preeclampsia

finding: The SNP rs7993214 was tightly linked to COG6, and its eQTL effects were found to be more significant in 8-mix stimulated SFs, suggesting a role in RA pathogenesis.
title: Synovial fibroblasts contribute to the genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis through the synergistic action of cytokines

finding: The TNFSF13B rs9514828 polymorphism was associated with the incidence of atherosclerosis and therapeutic outcomes in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus, marking its relevance in autoimmune diseases.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Annotated as an intron variant, rs9564313 was linked to the expression of the gene PCDH9 (Protocadherin-9) and was highlighted for its important function in transcriptome-wide association study (TWAS) and MAGMA results.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of major depression aids locus discovery, fine-mapping, gene prioritisation, and causal inference

finding: The rs374039502 variant generated a new PAS motif within the TNFSF13B gene and was linked to a higher risk of multiple sclerosis and SLE in the Sardinian population, illustrating the connection between genetic variations and complex disease susceptibility.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The rs877098 SNP was categorized as L4 and associated with numerous complex diseases including bipolar disorder, coronary artery disease, and type 1 and type 2 diabetes, indicating its extensive pleiotropic influence.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The SNP rs72474224 was represented in various formats including "GJB2, c.109G>A", "GJB2, p.Val37Ile", and "GJB2, V37I". This normalization was crucial for effective literature retrieval regarding the GJB2 gene, which is associated with hearing loss phenotypes.
title: variant2literature: full text literature search for genetic variants

finding: SNP rs921058 was included among the SNPs that overlapped with candidate cCREs connected to HLA-DRB1. The relevance to sEOAD was highlighted due to the cCREs being linked to down-regulated HLA-DRB1 expression in microglia.
title: Single-nucleus multiomics reveals the disrupted regulatory programs in three brain regions of sporadic early-onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs57438463 was found within the promoter region of ZDHHC20 in oligodendrocytes. Its presence was noted in the context of significant upregulation of ZDHHC20 in oligodendrocytes derived from sEOAD samples.
title: Single-nucleus multiomics reveals the disrupted regulatory programs in three brain regions of sporadic early-onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The finding indicated that CAD-associated SNP rs9515203 was linked to EC4-specific chromatin peaks. This suggested a potential role of this SNP in modulating coronary artery disease mechanisms through its association with specific endothelial cell phenotypes.
title: Multiomics of human aortic endothelial cells reveals cell subtypes with heterogeneous responses to canonical endothelial-to-mesenchymal perturbations

finding: The chromosomal position chr13:25945714:C:T refers to SNP rs332577759 which was classified in Category 2d based on its significant regulatory signal in pig genomics, indicating its role in affecting important physiological traits.
title: Annotation and assessment of functional variants in regulatory regions using epigenomic data in farm animals

finding: The SNP rs4143229 was found within the intron of the ENOX1 gene, implicated in autoimmune disorders and expressed in the nervous systems, thereby linking it to depression.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs1343605 was associated with the OLFM4 gene, which has established links to depression and inflammation, thereby demonstrating its specific association to depressive features.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: This SNP was also linked to cocaine use, with a significant P-value of 3.77 × 10^-8 according to the L-BRAT test, affirming its relevance in the context of the study.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: The study confirmed the potential involvement of the lead GWAS variant rs7993214 by utilizing CRISPR/Cas9 technology to show its role in gene regulation, specifically affecting the expression of genes within the COG6/FOXO1 locus. This finding emphasized the SNP's interaction with enhancers marked by H3K27ac within a relevant disease context.
title: Simultaneous analysis of open chromatin, promoter interactions and gene expression in stimulated T cells implicates causal genes for rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The missense variant rs116855232 in the NUDT15 gene caused an Arg139 to Cys substitution, which was associated with the accumulation of 6-mercaptopurine metabolites and resulted in cellular toxicity. This variant was linked to thiopurine-induced leukopenia during thiopurine treatments, indicating its clinical significance in the context of immunologic and cancer treatments.
title: Molecular dynamics simulations reveal the impact of NUTD15 variants in structural conformation and dynamics

finding: Located upstream of the ZMYM2 gene, SNP rs7982701 was associated with morphology-related traits like body mass index and adult body size. This placed it in the context of larger aggregation effects on physical phenotype.
title: A novel classification framework for genome-wide association study of whole brain MRI images using deep learning

finding: Similarly, the rs117135638 SNP in the essential EXOSC8 gene was validated as a GEMINI vulnerability, with 29% LOH observed across cancer types. This SNP demonstrated a C to A change, leading to a proline to histidine substitution critical for exosome complex assembly. Disruption of the relevant allele resulted in reduced proliferation of affected cells, signifying the potential for targeted therapies.
title: Loss of heterozygosity of essential genes represents a widespread class of potential cancer vulnerabilities

finding: The lead SNP rs1536776 explained most of the signal at its loci when conditioned on RNF219, resulting in a conditioning GWAS P value of 5.1E-02 and explaining 0.848 of the variance, marking it as a positive original finding connected to ADHD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs9574096, which coincided with an essential mutation site, was linked to mathematical ability and was located in the intronic region of the gene neurobeachin (NBEA). NBEA showed significantly higher expression in the embryonic neocortex of humans compared to macaques during early development. Furthermore, a correlation was observed where the expression of RFX3, an autism risk transcription factor bound to the macaque allele, was negatively correlated with NBEA expression, suggesting alterations in enhancer activity and gene expression associated with autism.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: Similar to rs9574096, the tag SNP rs9574095 was associated with mathematical ability and located in the same intronic region of the NBEA gene. Its findings aligned with the expression data that indicated heightened NBEA expression in the embryonic neocortex of humans versus macaques, further linking it to autism-related pathways through altered enhancer activities.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: The SNP rs117135638 within the EXOSC8 gene demonstrated a significant role as a GEMINI vulnerability, with allele-specific disruption of the C allele leading to decreased cell proliferation in sensitive contexts. The nucleotide change represented a proline to histidine substitution, and LOH was noted in 29% of cancers, which included a high prevalence in lung and ovarian cancers. This SNP was thus considered for targeted therapeutic strategies using CRISPR.
title: Loss of heterozygosity of essential genes represents a widespread class of potential cancer vulnerabilities

finding: The SNP rs139309608, located on chromosome 13 within an intron of the TMEM255B gene, showed a significant association with the horizontal component of brain asymmetry. It had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.17 and an additive effect of the T allele leading to a decrease in the measure, with a t-value of -5.49 and a p-value of 4.01e-08. This finding contributed to the understanding of molecular genetic factors influencing brain structural asymmetry.
title: Handedness and Other Variables Associated with Human Brain Asymmetrical Skew

finding: The SNP rs61736969 was identified as the causal variant influencing high risk of type 2 diabetes and significantly elevated 2-hour plasma glucose levels in the admixed Greenlandic population. It showed a recessive effect, and its statistical significance was consistent across different analysis methods.
title: Ancestry-specific association mapping in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs7330796 was highlighted as the lead SNP in the discovery part of the study conducted on the Greenlandic population. It was strongly associated with increased 2-hour plasma glucose levels. The effect was more significant in individuals who inherited both alleles from the Inuit population.
title: Ancestry-specific association mapping in admixed populations

finding: SNP rs1062087 was part of the four non-causal SNPs tested in relation to 2-hour plasma glucose levels. It indicated a more significant recessive effect with both alleles inherited from the Inuit population, supporting the notion that it is not a causal variant.
title: Ancestry-specific association mapping in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs2297206 was similarly assessed alongside other non-causal SNPs. It demonstrated that two inherited effect alleles from the Inuit population had a stronger recessive effect compared to those with European ancestry, suggesting it is non-causal.
title: Ancestry-specific association mapping in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs77685055 was identified as another non-causal SNP. The analysis indicated that the recessive effect was more pronounced when both alleles were from the Inuit population, further supporting its classification as a non-causal variant.
title: Ancestry-specific association mapping in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs9513900 on chromosome 13 was identified as a genome-wide significant variant associated with lung disease in Cystic Fibrosis (CF). Using the qJLS method, the researchers found that this variant had a minimal p-value of 3.12×10⁻⁸ and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.31. The study reported that rs9513900 was not previously identified in a meta-GWAS of CF, despite a similar estimated effect size. Additionally, rs9513900 showed evidence of being an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene NALCN in lung tissue with a p-value of 1×10⁻³ after Bonferroni correction. The variant demonstrated a positive effect of up to 0.074 on the pulmonary phenotype, with a median effect of 0.054, indicating that having one variant at this locus increased the median lung phenotype by 5.4%, contingent upon other predictors being fixed.
title: A robust association test leveraging unknown genetic interactions: Application to cystic fibrosis lung disease

finding: The SNP rs3742305 was identified as the lead candidate causal variant in the chr13:30956642-31116642 locus associated with T2D and BMI, linked to an eASQTL module for HMGB1 isoforms. This variant had a posterior probability of 49.3%, with its risk allele associated with an increase in one isoform and decreases in others, indicating potential implications for obesity and T2D development.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The indel <italic>BRCA2 P1062_Q1063fs</italic> matching rs80359374 was predicted as somatic. It was also curated as a cancer predisposition mutation on ClinVar.
title: RNAIndel: discovering somatic coding indels from tumor RNA-Seq data

finding: This SNP was reported as a known eQTL for F7, showing its regulatory influence within metabolic pathways.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The HTR2A rs6314 C/C genotype was correlated with higher cholesterol levels during aripiprazole treatment compared to T allele carriers, suggesting a genetic impact on lipid profiles induced by the treatment.
title: Metabolic effects of aripiprazole and olanzapine multiple-dose treatment in healthy volunteers. Association with pharmacogenetics

finding: The rs56314249 SNP overlapped with the FLT1 locus and represented a coding variant that underwent positive selection. It was identified as a synonymous variant, meaning it did not alter the amino acid sequence, which complicated its interpretation regarding functional significance.
title: Archaic Adaptive Introgression in Modern Human Reproductive Genes

finding: The C-allele of rs4769613 was identified as a high-confidence placental risk factor for preeclampsia, indicating its importance in reproductive health, particularly in pregnancy-related complications.
title: Archaic Adaptive Introgression in Modern Human Reproductive Genes

finding: SNP rs11843418 was identified as one of the strongest associations in the diverticulitis GWAS, showing positive association but was not detected in the NLP-enriched GWAS possibly due to differences in statistical power or genetic composition.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The SNP rs9565028 showed FDR-significant associations with genitourinary manifestations, particularly with functional disorders of the bladder, suggesting its relevance beyond diverticular disease.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: Located in the COL4A2 gene, rs11838776 was strongly linked with vascular diseases and ischemic events, reiterating its role as a significant participant in white matter pathology.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: This SNP was identified in the COL4A2 gene region, previously indicated for associations with coronary artery disease and myocardial infarction, showcasing its relevance in cerebrovascular pathology.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: Previously linked to total WMH, this SNP was shown to be in high linkage disequilibrium with another important SNP, suggesting a strong shared genetic architecture.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs12020259 was identified as a positive original finding linked to the regulation of cancer cell division, particularly relating to the function of Rab11 and Rab35 in cytokinesis. This SNP was associated with aberrant levels of F-actin in the intercellular bridge during the late stages of cell division, highlighting its potential role in oncogenic pathways.
title: The unique contributions of Rab11 and Rab35 to the completion of cell division

finding: The SNP rs80338851, reported as c.660+1G>A, was found to be the most common mutation associated with Peters-plus syndrome (PPS). This finding indicated that this mutation has a significant role in the pathogenesis of Peters-plus syndrome, corroborated by previous research.
title: In Silico Analysis of B3GALTL Gene Reveling 13 Novel Mutations Associated with Peters’-plus syndrome

finding: The SNP rs7998201 was found to be significantly associated with the expression of the TEX30 gene. This association was shown to be modulated by the methylation status of a nearby CpG site, indicating that rs7998201 does not directly act as an eQTL or meQTL but interacts with gene expression through the methylated site.
title: memo-eQTL: DNA methylation modulated genetic variant effect on gene transcriptional regulation

finding: The ERCC5 rs2016073 variant was identified as associated with platinum response in CRC, contributing to the understanding of pharmacogenomic predictability.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The ERCC5 rs751402 polymorphism was also noted in association with platinum response, reinforcing its significance in CRC treatment outcomes.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The VEGFR1 rs9582036 variant was linked to less favorable treatment outcomes with bevacizumab in CRC.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The finding highlighted that rs3742305 (chr13:31036642:C>G) was the candidate causal variant underlying the T2D and BMI GWAS associations, impacting the differential usage of HMGB1 isoforms during pancreas development.
title: Disease-associated regulatory variation often displays plasticity or temporal-specificity in fetal pancreas

finding: SNP rs7987944 was identified as a trans pQTL for TALDO1, further reinforcing the connection between metabolic regulation and AF.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs17446614, located in the FOXO1 gene, was also linked to genetic susceptibility to diabetic nephropathy. Similar to rs10823108, this SNP was noted for its relevance in the context of metabolic disorders, contributing to the understanding of diabetes and its complications.
title: A natural genetic variation screen identifies insulin signaling, neuronal communication, and innate immunity as modifiers of hyperglycemia in the absence of Sirt1

finding: The SNP rs4769613 was associated with preeclampsia through its presence in preeclampsia-specific enhancers linked to the gene FLT1. This enhancer activity was characterized by a gain of chromatin accessibility and a loss of DNA methylation at H3K27ac-marked loci, indicating a direct genetic influence on preeclampsia-like phenotypes. The research highlighted that this locus was involved in the regulation of FLT1 during the transformation from trophectoderm to a functional placenta.
title: Developmentally Delayed Epigenetic Reprogramming Underlying the Pathogenesis of Preeclampsia

finding: The SNP rs12050029 was similarly identified as a preeclampsia susceptibility locus found within preeclampsia-specific enhancers of the FLT1 gene. The study described that these enhancers showed increased chromatin accessibility and decreased DNA methylation, which were linked to altered regulatory mechanisms affecting FLT1 expression, potentially contributing to the pathogenesis of preeclampsia.
title: Developmentally Delayed Epigenetic Reprogramming Underlying the Pathogenesis of Preeclampsia

finding: The SNP rs4769613 was identified as part of preeclampsia-gained enhancers for the gene FLT1, which is associated with preeclampsia. The finding indicated that it was linked to a gain of chromatin accessibility and a loss of DNA methylation on H3K27ac-marked loci, contributing to the development of a preeclampsia-like phenotype.
title: Developmentally Delayed Epigenetic Reprogramming Underlying the Pathogenesis of Preeclampsia

finding: The SNP rs12050029 was also identified as a susceptibility locus for preeclampsia, encompassed within the FLT1 preeclampsia-gained enhancers. Similar to rs4769613, this SNP was associated with chromatin accessibility changes and loss of DNA methylation in the context of preeclampsia, thereby suggesting its role in the underlying pathophysiology of this condition.
title: Developmentally Delayed Epigenetic Reprogramming Underlying the Pathogenesis of Preeclampsia

finding: Resulted in D2723H in BRCA2, associated with breast and ovarian cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The SNP rs1037271 is an intronic variant in the DGKH gene. While specific findings regarding its association with phenotypes were limited, it was noted to be among the loci affecting CaSR signaling relevant to nephrolithiasis.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: This SNP was identified as having a significant <trans> interchromosomal connection with <RAD21>, influencing transcript levels of <AKAP11>. This suggested that rs238256 plays a role in the co-regulation of oncogenes, potentially affecting cancer onset.
title: Genetic Variation as a Long-Distance Modulator of RAD21 Expression in Humans

finding: The SNP rs4771268 was the sole Consensus SNP identified within the MBNL2 locus, and it also served as the lead GWAS SNP. It was found to overlap with regulatory elements active in oligodendrocytes, indicating its important role in Parkinson's Disease pathology.
title: Fine-mapping of Parkinson’s disease susceptibility loci identifies putative causal variants

finding: The SNP rs73183592 showed a 500 kb long-range interaction with the gene FOXO1, important for regulatory T cell functions. This interaction was specific to HaCaT keratinocytes, revealing an important link in the context of psoriasis development.
title: An active chromatin interactome in relevant cell lines elucidates biological mechanisms at genetic risk loci for dermatological traits

finding: The SNP rs104894421 was associated with Lig4 syndrome, a disease characterized by skeletal abnormalities. Individual S15 from the Encrusted pottery culture exhibited the defining skeletal features of this disease, suggesting the possible presence of this allele in the population despite initial concerns about the reliability of the genetic evidence.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: The SNP rs6313, located in the serotonin 2A receptor gene (HTR2A), was found to have a significant association with sleep bruxism (SB). Specifically, the study involved human induced pluripotent stem cell (hiPSC)-derived neurons obtained from SB patients with the risk allele (C/C genotype) and compared them with neurons from unaffected controls (T/T genotype). The neurons from SB patients displayed altered electrophysiological characteristics in the early stages of neurogenesis, showing shorter action potential half durations and an increased evoked firing capability. This work marked the first in vitro modeling of SB using specific hiPSC lines, suggesting that the rs6313 variant may play a role in the excitability and functional properties of neurons associated with SB.
title: Electrophysiological maturation and increased excitability of human iPSC-derived neurons in HTR2A variant-related sleep bruxism

finding: The C231Y SNP was identified as a damaging mutation affecting the FLT3 gene, which was linked to the pathogenesis of acute myeloid leukemia (AML). This mutation involved the change in amino acid from Cysteine to Tyrosine at position 231.

finding: The C681 SNP was part of the findings indicating a significant alteration in protein structure and function in FLT3, causing a mutation from Cysteine to Serine at position 681, thus classified as damaging and relevant to leukemia development.

finding: The C925Y SNP was recognized for its damaging effect on the FLT3 gene, substituting Cysteine for Tyrosine at position 925 and affecting the cancer-related signaling functions.

finding: The F349C SNP was pinpointed as a damaging mutation where Phenylalanine was replaced with Cysteine at position 349, impacting FLT3’s signaling pathways relevant to leukemia.

finding: The M908V SNP resulted in the mutation of Methionine to Valine at position 908 and was classified as damaging with implications for leukemia signaling pathways in FLT3.

finding: The P890R SNP, which altered Proline to Arginine at position 890, was emphasized as damaging concerning the mutation in FLT3 linked to AML.
title: Twenty novel nsSNPs may affect FLT3 gene leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using in silico analysis

finding: The V643D SNP was identified as a damaging alteration where Valine was replaced by Aspartic acid at position 643, adversely impacting FLT3's function in AML.
title: Twenty novel nsSNPs may affect FLT3 gene leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using in silico analysis

finding: The W383C SNP was characterized by a mutation changing Tryptophan to Cysteine at position 383, recognized as damaging within the context of FLT3 signaling pathways associated with AML.
title: Twenty novel nsSNPs may affect FLT3 gene leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using in silico analysis

finding: The Y702C SNP, with a mutation from Tyrosine to Cysteine at position 702, was noted as damaging in relation to the pathogenicity of FLT3 in AML.
title: Twenty novel nsSNPs may affect FLT3 gene leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using in silico analysis

finding: The Y865C SNP involved a mutation changing Tyrosine to Cysteine at position 865, identified as a damaging factor affecting FLT3’s functionality associated with leukemia.
title: Twenty novel nsSNPs may affect FLT3 gene leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using in silico analysis

finding: The Y874C SNP was documented as damaging, where a mutation from Tyrosine to Cysteine at position 874 impacted the FLT3 protein structure, relevant to AML pathways.
title: Twenty novel nsSNPs may affect FLT3 gene leading to Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) using in silico analysis

finding: The SNP rs114066381-A was significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) exclusively in females of the Pelotas cohort. It exhibited a strong effect with a beta of 3.99 kg/m² per A allele (95% CI: 2.32-5.65, p=2.76×10^-6). The effect was replicated in other cohorts, confirming its importance as a potential regulatory variant linked to BMI in females.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs113214936-G was associated with obesity-related traits and was located in the intron of the MTUS2 gene, related to BMI in females, emphasizing the role of European ancestry in this context.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The variant rs7323267 was positively correlated with MPN risk and found within an intron of the FOXO1 gene, indicating its potential involvement in HSC biology.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The SNP rs1753776 was linked to the gene Protein Kinase C delta (PKCdelta) in the association study, suggesting its importance in both circadian rhythms and photoperiod responses as indicated by the differential phenotypes of the respective mutant.
title: Characterizing Genetic Mechanisms Involved in Measuring Day-length in Drosophila melanogaster

finding: The G72 rs1421292 polymorphism was found to be associated with verbal function in individuals with schizophrenia. This genetic variant has been implicated in the abnormal gray matter volume of the right middle temporal gyrus, a region linked to auditory hallucinations, suggesting a connection between this SNP and psychiatric symptoms in schizophrenia.
title: Alteration of Power Law Scaling of Spontaneous Brain Activity in Schizophrenia

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs150928081, situated in the FREM2 gene, was also significantly enriched in GBA1-N409S carriers, reinforcing its relevance in the context of Parkinson's disease genetic risk factors.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs61998252 was recognized for its nominally significant association in LRRK2 G2019S carriers, marking it as a potential player in Parkinson's disease genetics.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: Finally, the SNP rs61740542 was also noted for its nominal significance among LRRK2 G2019S carriers, linking it to the genetic risk factors associated with Parkinson's disease.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs9585056, previously classified as intergenic, was found to be located in the lncRNA ARGI (Antiviral Response Gene Inducer). This SNP was associated with type 1 diabetes (T1D) and influenced the secondary structure of ARGI. Functional analysis indicated that this SNP was linked to an overactivation of the type I interferon response in pancreatic beta cells and enhanced interaction with CTCF when harboring the T1D risk allele (rs9585056-G) compared to the protective allele (rs9585056-A). This highlighted the role of ARGI in mediating T1D pathogenesis through antiviral gene networks.
title: The type 1 diabetes-associated lncRNA ARGI participates in virus-induced pancreatic β cell inflammation

finding: Identified as a stop-gain variant in <italic>BRCA2</italic> (p.K3326*), this variant was previously recognized as deleterious and implicated in breast cancer risk.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The SNP rs114066381-A was significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) specifically in females from the Pelotas cohort, showing a strong effect (beta=3.99±0.84 kg/m² per A allele, p=2.76 x 10^-6). Its effect on BMI was replicated in the São Paulo cohort, demonstrating its relevance in South American admixed populations. This SNP had a frequency of approximately 1.1% in the study populations, increasing to 9% among morbidly obese women.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: This SNP, located in the intron of the MTUS2 gene, was associated with obesity-related traits in women, indicating the complexity of gene-phenotype relationships influenced by genetic ancestry.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs7335631 was noted to be nearby rs114066381, and while not in strong linkage disequilibrium, its associations pointed towards complex interactions of regulatory variants influencing BMI.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs80285134 was a height-specific BMI variant identified through mtCOJO analysis. It exhibited differential effects on BMI, specifically increasing BMI in short people (beta=0.30, P=5.9×10−4) while decreasing BMI in tall people (beta=−0.37, P=1.7×10−6). Additionally, it was significantly associated with bone mineral density, indicating a potential role in the pathogenesis of osteoporosis.
title: Genome-wide analyses point to differences in genetic architecture of BMI between tall and short people

finding: The SNP rs146350366 located on chromosome 13 was identified as a genome-wide significant association with sporadic miscarriage in a European ancestry meta-analysis, demonstrating a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1.2% and a P-value of 3.2×10^-8. This association was suggested to involve the gene FGF9, which plays a role in pregnancy maintenance and progesterone production.
title: The genetic architecture of sporadic and recurrent miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs76559378 at 13q13 demonstrated a suggestive association with RBC deformability, with a p-value of 9.74 x 10^-7. This SNP is in strong linkage disequilibrium with the exonic SNP rs201936594, which had a high CADD score indicating a likely deleterious effect, hinting at its potential impact in hematologic conditions related to malaria.
title: Splenic clearance of rigid erythrocytes as an inherited mechanism for splenomegaly and natural resistance to malaria

finding: The SNP was linked with LAMP1 and was implicated in inflammatory responses, as it co-localized with GWAS signals associated with C-reactive protein levels.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs9574096 was identified as an essential mutation site linked to the tag SNP rs9574095, which was associated with the trait 'Mathematical ability'. Both variants were found in the intronic region of the neurobeachin (NBEA) gene, an autism-linked gene that regulates signals at neuronal junctions. NBEA exhibited significantly higher embryonic neocortex expression in humans compared to macaques at early developmental stages, indicating a connection to enhanced cognitive traits.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: The SNP rs9574095, a tag SNP for rs9574096, showed a significant association with 'Mathematical ability'. It was linked to enhanced expression of the NBEA gene in humans during embryonic neocortex development, and represented differences in transcription factor binding between human and macaque alleles.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: The variant rs1367115848 disrupted HNF4 binding at the F7 promoter, leading to severe factor VII deficiency. This finding highlighted its significance in the context of Mendelian disorders.
title: GPN-MSA: an alignment-based DNA language model for genome-wide variant effect prediction

finding: The SNP rs9585056 was selected for the corrected credible set as it was positioned in the 3' UTR of the lncRNA AL136961.1 and had implications for regulating GPR183, although the evidence of causality compared to the intergenic rs9517719 was inconclusive.
title: Improving the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: A significant novel association was established for rs111440455 within PIBF1 and serum creatinine levels (p-value 1.08e-09), which replicated in meta-analysis, hinting at its role related to ciliogenesis in kidney health.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: Variant rs9301897 was strongly associated with Nuclei_RadialDistribution_RadialCV_Brightfield_2of4 in isolated cells, lying within the gene GPC6 on chromosome 13. The MAF was 0.13, with an effect size of -0.31 (SE 0.05) and a P-value of 4.5×10^-10. Genetic variants in GPC6 are implicated in Alzheimer's disease and cellular functions related to growth and division, highlighting its potential role in altering nuclear localization during mitosis.
title: High-dimensional phenotyping to define the genetic basis of cellular morphology

finding: The rs8191974 variant in the Gas6 gene was reported to be associated with type 2 diabetes in northern Chinese Han populations, suggesting its potential relevance in metabolic diseases.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: This SNP also indicated a higher Hexp value, aligning with inferences of substantial genetic diversity.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The SNP rs9319428 was linked to the FLT1 locus, strengthening its association as an eQTL.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: The SNP rs12020265 was associated with the efficacy of proteasome inhibitors in the treatment of multiple myeloma. This finding related specifically to the role of proteasome function in cancer therapy, highlighting the potential of targeting proteasomes for therapeutic interventions.

finding: The SNP rs61736969 was identified as the causative variant in the TBC1D4 gene, showing a recessive effect related to type 2 diabetes and elevated 2-hour plasma glucose levels in the Greenlandic population.

finding: This SNP was associated with differential regulatory activity in the POU4F1 gene, showing that its allele-specific effects are context-dependent and linked to large artery stroke and pulse pressure.
title: Functional non-coding SNPs in human endothelial cells fine-map vascular trait associations

finding: The SNP rs72474224 C>T in GJB2 was linked to non-syndromic genetic deafness, the most prevalent genetic disorder in the Vietnamese population. Its allele frequency in Vietnam was found to be 60% higher than in East Asia and significantly higher than in the world population (13.40% in Vietnam, 8.35% in East Asia, and 0.76% globally), consistent with a carrier frequency of 1 in 5 in the Vietnamese population.
title: Genetic profiling of 2,683 Vietnamese genomes from non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The SNP rs76428106 exhibited the largest risk effect for type 1 diabetes, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.53 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1.29%. This association was noted for its role in increasing monocyte count and was highlighted as a significant risk factor outside the HLA region for T1D.
title: Enhanced genetic analysis of type 1 diabetes by selecting variants on both effect size and significance, and by integration with autoimmune thyroid disease

finding: The SNP rs1272422512 resulted in an R9Q mutation that significantly increased the nucleation of the ADan peptide, which is involved in Danish dementia.
title: Deep mutagenesis reveals the distinct mutational landscape of ADan and ABri amyloid nucleation

finding: The SNP rs1455609180 caused a K32T mutation that also increased nucleation in the context of the ADan peptide, which is a key factor in the mechanism of Danish dementia.
title: Deep mutagenesis reveals the distinct mutational landscape of ADan and ABri amyloid nucleation

finding: The SNP rs578006622 led to an A7S mutation that increased nucleation in the ABri peptide, related to British dementia, highlighting its role in amyloid formation.

title: Single cell ‘omic profiles of human aortic endothelial cells in vitro and human atherosclerotic lesions ex vivo reveals heterogeneity of endothelial subtype and response to activating perturbations

finding: The SNP rs104894421 was associated with Lig4 syndrome in individual S15, where a genotype likelihood (GL) of 0.999 suggested a high probability of its presence. Specific skeletal features, including congenital hip dysplasia, were identified in S15, indicating potential symptoms of the syndrome.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: The SNP rs80358920 was linked to a tumor marker associated with the BRCA2 gene in individual S9. This variant was noted to be particularly prevalent in contemporary Asian populations, suggesting its historical relevance in the genetic landscape of the analyzed Bronze Age individuals.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: The SNP rs877098 was categorized as L4, linked to alcohol dependence and multiple complex diseases including bipolar disorder, coronary artery disease, Crohn's disease, rheumatoid arthritis, type 1 diabetes, and type 2 diabetes.

finding: The loss-of-function SNP rs41281112 was associated with decreased levels of circulating vitamin B12. This variant converted Arg259 into a premature stop codon in the CLYBL gene, resulting in the loss of CLYBL protein, which is crucial for the proper metabolism of vitamin B12 derivatives.
title: CLYBL averts methylmalonyl-CoA mutase inhibition and loss of vitamin B12 by repairing malyl-CoA

finding: The SNP rs3783185 caused an Ile241Val mutation in the CLYBL protein sequence, which was relevant to the study as it was indicated as a natural variant. This variant might influence the function of CLYBL, although specific functional consequences were not detailed in the findings.
title: CLYBL averts methylmalonyl-CoA mutase inhibition and loss of vitamin B12 by repairing malyl-CoA

finding: SNP rs1766280 was associated with increased hardness in boiled yam.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The Klotho rs495392 polymorphism was found to have a protective association against hepatic steatosis, suggesting a potential link to kidney disease via metabolic health.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Significantly associated with tumor grade (P=1.78×10⁻³).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The EDNRB polymorphism rs10507875 showed joint effects with another SNP in influencing T2DM and diabetic retinopathy outcomes, indicating possible interactive genetic effects.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The COL4A1 gene polymorphism rs605143 was found to associate with coronary artery disease, a common comorbidity linked with T2DM.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs565470 variant in COL4A1 exhibited significant associations with coronary artery disease related to T2DM complications.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The C-allele of rs4769613, located near the FLT1 locus, represented a high-confidence placental risk factor for preeclampsia. This finding was significant in the context of cardiovascular development, suggesting that variations at this SNP could affect placental health and subsequently influence cardiovascular outcomes.
title: The human FLT1 regulatory element directs vascular expression and modulates angiogenesis pathways in vitro and in vivo

finding: The SNP rs573983368, an intronic variant in the DACH1 gene, exhibited an age-dependent effect on white matter cerebrum volume change. DACH1 is associated with regulating gene expression and plays a role in the development of neuroprogenitor cells.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: The human IFITM3 rs12552-C SNP was proposed to result in IFITM3 plasma membrane localization and was identified as a risk factor for severe COVID-19 in an early study involving a limited cohort. This suggests a possible link between this SNP and increased disease severity during SARS-CoV-2 infections.
title: Opposing activities of IFITM proteins in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The SNP rs80338939, a frameshift variant (35delG) in the GJB2 gene, accounted for 60% of the known autosomal recessive variants associated with non-syndromic hearing loss in White individuals according to a study conducted by Putcha et al. in 2007.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The missense substitution SNP rs35887622 (101T > C or M34T) accounted for 12% of non-syndromic hearing loss cases in White individuals in the same study by Putcha et al. in 2007. It exhibited lower penetrance compared to frameshift variants.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The SNP rs80338942, a frameshift variant (167delT), was noted as the most common variant in the Ashkenazi Jewish population associated with severe hearing loss, contributing to the understanding of genetic etiology of deafness.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The SNP rs12020259 was identified as a risk factor associated with glioblastoma. The study highlighted that it played a significant role in the modulation of tumor-promoting activities through its effect on the expression of endosomal GTPases like Rab35 and Arf5. Specifically, the SNP's association with the regulation of these GTPases led to changes in tumor cell behavior, including increased migration, invasiveness, and proliferation, ultimately contributing to glioblastoma progression.
title: An Arf/Rab cascade controls the growth and invasiveness of glioblastoma

finding: The lead SNP rs1536776 was found to explain most of the signal attributed to RNF219, correlating with ADHD risk. The original GWAS P-value was 5.5E-07, and after conditioning on RNF219, the lead SNP GWAS P-value shifted to 5.1E-02, explaining 0.848 of the variance.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs72474224 C>T in gene GJB2 was associated with deafness, autosomal recessive 1A which had a carrier frequency of 17.2% (1 in 6) in the Vietnamese population, making it the most prevalent disorder in this cohort.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs4143229 was associated with depression without association to neuroticism and resides in an intron of the ENOX1 gene, which is expressed in the nervous system and implicated in autoimmune disorders.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs1343605 showed an association with depression and is located near the OLFM4 gene, which has been linked to several conditions including depression and inflammation.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs9585056 was selected after correction, being located in the 3' UTR of lncRNA AL136961.1, though it lacked conclusive evidence for causality compared to rs9517719.
title: Correcting the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: The Olink-specific variant rs4512994 associated with sRANKL showed a connection to known susceptibility for bone mineral density, indicating a strong phenotypic relevance.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The rs6563275 SNP was originally found to be significantly associated with the lactase persistence phenotype in the Fulani population during the Genome Wide Association Study (GWAS). This SNP exhibited a higher association with glucose levels after lactose ingestion, with an effect size of 38.7% (p-value = 6.62×10⁻⁸). Even though it is located approximately 2.7 Mb upstream of the nearest gene, SPRY2, it was noted that its effect on the lactase digestion phenotype works independently of the T-13910 SNP, suggesting specific genetic factors contribute to lactose metabolism in this population.
title: Population history and genetic adaptation of the Fulani nomads: Inferences from genome-wide data and the lactase persistence trait

finding: The SNP rs11571833 in the BRCA2 gene was identified as associated with breast cancer risk in a genome-wide association study (GWAS), showing a p-value of 2 × 10^-6. The BRCA2 gene is a well-known tumor suppressor that plays a crucial role in DNA repair. Given its association with established breast cancer risk factors, this SNP is considered a likely true finding, demonstrating the utility of using prior biological knowledge in enhancing the power of genetic testing.
title: Priors, population sizes, and power in genome-wide hypothesis tests

finding: The SNP rs72474224 C>T in gene GJB2 was associated with deafness, autosomal recessive 1A, which had a carrier frequency of 17.2% (1 in 6) in the Vietnamese population, making it the most prevalent disorder in the study.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1021188 was linked to cortical porosity, confirming its relation to skeletal traits in cortical bone structure based on earlier studies. This connection emphasized the distinct effects of genetic variants on different types of bone attributes.
title: Genetic dissection of femoral and tibial microarchitecture

finding: The rs374039502 variant caused the appearance of a new PAS motif in the TNFSF13B gene, and it was associated with higher risks of both multiple sclerosis and systemic lupus erythematosus in the Sardinian population.
title: The genetic determinants of the relative expression of alternative 3’UTR isoforms in human

finding: The SNP rs17446614 in FOXO1 was also determined to contribute to genetic susceptibility to diabetic nephropathy. This finding highlighted the role of FOXO1 in metabolic pathways related to diabetes, shedding light on potential therapeutic targets for managing diabetes-related complications.
title: A natural genetic variation screen identifies insulin signaling, neuronal communication, and innate immunity as modifiers of hyperglycemia in the absence of Sirt1

finding: The missense variant rs80359104 (c.8524C>T/p.R2842C) in BRCA2 was identified as a pathogenic variant associated with primary ovarian insufficiency (POI) in a patient from a consanguineous family. It exhibited homozygosity in the patient and was absent in unrelated fertile controls, with a very low minor allele frequency (MAF). Functional data indicated that the variant had a role in fertility, as it was predicted to be pathogenic by 16 out of 17 software tools. The variant's effects on chromosomal breaks and homologous recombination function suggested it contributed to the absence of somatic pathologies in the patient.
title: A homozygous hypomorphic BRCA2 variant causes primary ovarian insufficiency without cancer or Fanconi anemia traits

finding: The SNP rs9533799, located in the lncRNA SMIM2-AS1, was identified as being up-regulated in excitatory neurons in the context of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) as compared to the neuronal population from non-pathological controls (PN). This suggests a potential role in ALS pathogenesis.
title: Transcriptional profiling of human brain cortex identifies novel lncRNA-mediated networks dysregulated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
